lead_paragraph: A deputy sheriff charged in a 2013 shooting appears to be the first law enforcement officer to successfully invoke the state’s “Stand Your Ground” law in his defense.

headline.print_headline: Case Dropped for Deputy in 2013 Killing
headline.main: Florida Judge Dismisses Charge Against Deputy Who Killed Man Holding Air Rifle

snippet: A deputy sheriff charged in a 2013 shooting appears to be the first law enforcement officer to successfully invoke the state’s “Stand Your Ground” law in his defense....
abstract: Judge Michael Usan of Circuit Court in Broward County, Fla, dismisses manslaughter charge against Deputy Sheriff Peter A Peraza related to shooting death of Jermaine McBean; Peraza, who shot McBean while he was carrying air rifle on way home, was cleared under Florida's 2005 Stand Your Ground law.
